Analyze pathway enrichment

Source: R/pathway_analysis.R
analyze_pathway_enrichment.Rd

Performs pathway enrichment analysis on a Seurat object using KEGG pathways. This function calculates the mean expression of genes in each pathway and performs statistical testing to identify significantly enriched pathways.

Usage

analyze_pathway_enrichment(
  seurat_obj,
  kegg_pathways,
  min_genes = 5,
  max_genes = 500,
  p_cutoff = 0.05,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

seurat_obj

Seurat object. The Seurat object containing gene expression data.

kegg_pathways

List. A list of KEGG pathways where each element is a character vector of gene names. The names of the list should be pathway IDs.

min_genes

Integer. Minimum number of genes required in a pathway for analysis (default: 5).

max_genes

Integer. Maximum number of genes allowed in a pathway for analysis (default: 500).

p_cutoff

Numeric. P-value cutoff for significant pathways (default: 0.05).

verbose

Logical. Whether to print progress messages (default: TRUE).

Value

A data frame containing pathway enrichment results with columns:

  • pathway: Pathway ID

  • n_genes: Number of genes in the pathway

  • mean_expr: Mean expression of pathway genes

  • sd_expr: Standard deviation of pathway expression

  • p_value: P-value from statistical test

  • adj_p_value: Adjusted p-value (FDR)

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Validates input parameters and data

  2. Filters pathways based on gene count

  3. Calculates mean expression for each pathway

  4. Performs statistical testing

  5. Adjusts p-values for multiple testing

See also

create_pathway_heatmap for visualizing pathway results analyze_pathway_activity for analyzing pathway activity

Examples

# Example with mock pathway activity matrix
pathway_activities <- matrix(
    rnorm(150),
    nrow = 15,
    dimnames = list(
        paste0("Pathway", seq_len(15)),
        paste0("Sample", seq_len(10))
    )
)
plot <- create_pathway_heatmap(pathway_activities)
#> Error in create_pathway_heatmap(pathway_activities): seurat_obj must be a Seurat object
